00061 #define XNARCH_DEFAULT_TICK  1000000 /* ns, i.e. 1ms */
00062 #define XNARCH_IRQ_MAX       32
00063 #define XNARCH_SIG_RESTART   SIGUSR1
00064 
00065 struct xnthread;
00066 
00067 typedef struct xnarchtcb {      /* Per-thread arch-dependent block */
00068 
00069     const char *name;           /* Symbolic name of thread (can be NULL) */
00070     struct xnthread *thread;    /* VM thread pointer (opaque) */
00071     void *khandle;              /* Kernel handle (opaque) */
00072     void (*entry)(void *);      /* Thread entry */
00073     void *cookie;               /* Thread cookie passed on entry */
00074     int imask;                  /* Initial interrupt mask */
00075     jmp_buf rstenv;             /* Restart context info */
00076     pid_t ppid;
00077     int syncflag;
00078     pthread_t thid;
00079 
00080     /* The following fields are not used by the Fusion skin, however
00081        they are set by the nucleus. */
00082     unsigned stacksize;         /* Aligned size of stack (bytes) */
00083     unsigned long *stackbase;   /* Stack space */
00084 
00085 } xnarchtcb_t;
00086 
00087 extern xnarchtcb_t *vml_root;
00088 
00089 extern xnarchtcb_t *vml_current;
00090 
00091 extern int vml_irqlock;

00104 #define printk                     printf
00105 #define xnarch_llimd(ll,m,d)       ((int)(ll) * (int)(m) / (int)(d))
00106 #define xnarch_imuldiv(i,m,d)      ((int)(i) * (int)(m) / (int)(d))
00107 #define xnarch_ulldiv(ull,uld,rem) (((*rem) = ((ull) % (uld))), (ull) / (uld))
00108 #define xnarch_ullmod(ull,uld,rem) ((*rem) = ((ull) % (uld)))
00109 #define xnarch_stack_size(tcb)     ((tcb)->stacksize)

00111 static inline int __attribute__ ((unused))
00112 xnarch_read_environ (const char *name, const char **ptype, void *pvar)
00113 
00114 {
00115     char *value;
00116 
00117     if (*ptype == NULL)
00118         return 0;       /* Already read in */
00119 
00120     *ptype = NULL;
00121 
00122     value = getenv(name);
00123 
00124     if (!value)
00125         return -1;
00126 
00127     if (**ptype == 's')
00128         *((char **)pvar) = value;
00129     else
00130         *((int *)pvar) = atoi(value);
00131 
00132     return 1;
00133 }
00134 
00135 static int inline xnarch_lock_irq (void) {
00136 
00137     extern int vml_irqlock;
00138     return xnarch_atomic_xchg(&vml_irqlock,1);
00139 }
00140 
00141 static inline void xnarch_unlock_irq (int x) {
00142 
00143     extern int vml_irqlock, vml_irqpend;
00144 
00145     if (!x && vml_irqlock)
00146         {
00147         if (xnarch_atomic_xchg(&vml_irqpend,0))
00148             __pthread_release_vm(&vml_irqlock);
00149         else
00150             vml_irqlock = 0;
00151         }
00152 }
00153 
00154 void xnarch_sync_irq(void);
00155 
00156 int xnarch_setimask(int imask);

00158 typedef int spl_t;
00159 
00160 #define splhigh(x)    ((x) = xnarch_lock_irq())
00161 #define splexit(x)    xnarch_unlock_irq(x)
00162 #define splnone()     xnarch_unlock_irq(0)

00190 
00191 int vml_irqlock = 0;
00192 
00193 int vml_irqpend = 0;
00194 
00195 void xnarch_sync_irq (void)
00196 
00197 {
00198     if (vml_irqlock)
00199         __pthread_hold_vm(&vml_irqpend);
00200 }
00201 
00202 static inline int xnarch_hook_irq (unsigned irq,
00203                                    void (*handler)(unsigned irq,
00204                                                    void *cookie),
00205                                    void *cookie) {
00206     if (irq == 0)
00207         return -EINVAL; /* Reserved for the timer thread. */
00208 
00209     return -ENOSYS;
00210 }

00213     return -ENOSYS;
00214 }

00217     return -ENOSYS;
00218 }

00221     return -ENOSYS;

00225     /* Nop */
00226 }

00236 int vml_done = 0;

00238 static inline int xnarch_init (void) {
00239     return 0;

00242 static inline void xnarch_exit (void) {

00245 int vml_init_nanokernel(void);
00246 void vml_cleanup_nanokernel(void);
00247 int vml_init_skin(void);
00248 void vml_cleanup_skin(void);
00249 int vml_init_application(void);
00250 void vml_cleanup_application(void);
00251 
00252 static void xnarch_restart_handler (int sig) {
00253 
00254     longjmp(vml_current->rstenv,1);
00255 }
00256 
00257 void xnarch_exit_handler (int sig)
00258 
00259 {
00260     vml_done = 1;
00261     __pthread_activate_vm(vml_root->khandle,vml_current->khandle);
00262     exit(99);
00263 }
00264 
00265 int main (int argc, char *argv[])
00266 
00267 {
00268     struct sigaction sa;
00269     int err;
00270 
00271     if (geteuid() !=0)
00272         {
00273         fprintf(stderr,"This program must be run with root privileges");
00274         exit(1);
00275         }
00276 
00277     err = vml_init_nanokernel();
00278 
00279     if (err)
00280         {
00281         fprintf(stderr,"init_nanokernel() failed, err=%x\n",err);
00282         exit(2);
00283         }
00284 
00285     err = vml_init_skin();
00286 
00287     if (err)
00288         {
00289         fprintf(stderr,"init_skin() failed, err=%x\n",err);
00290         exit(3);
00291         }
00292 
00293     err = vml_init_application();
00294 
00295     if (err)
00296         {
00297         fprintf(stderr,"init_application() failed, err=%x\n",err);
00298         exit(4);
00299         }
00300 
00301     sa.sa_handler = &xnarch_restart_handler;
00302     sigemptyset(&sa.sa_mask);
00303     sa.sa_flags = SA_RESTART;
00304     sigaction(XNARCH_SIG_RESTART,&sa,NULL);
00305 
00306     sa.sa_handler = &xnarch_exit_handler;
00307     sa.sa_flags = 0;
00308     sigaction(SIGTERM,&sa,NULL);
00309     sigaction(SIGHUP,&sa,NULL);
00310     sigaction(SIGINT,&sa,NULL);
00311 
00312     while (!vml_done)
00313         __pthread_idle_vm(&vml_irqlock);
00314 
00315     vml_cleanup_application();
00316     vml_cleanup_skin();
00317     vml_cleanup_nanokernel();
00318 
00319     exit(0);
00320 }
00321 
00322 #endif  /* !XENO_MAIN_MODULE */

00343 #ifdef XENO_POD_MODULE
00344 
00345 static void *vml_timer_handle;
00346 
00347 xnsysinfo_t vml_info;
00348 
00349 xnarchtcb_t *vml_root;
00350 
00351 xnarchtcb_t *vml_current;
00352 
00353 /* NOTES:
00354 
00355    o IRQ threads have no TCB, since they are not known by the VM
00356    abstraction.
00357 
00358    o All in-kernel IRQ threads serving the VM have the same priority
00359    level, except when they wait on a synchonization barrier.
00360 
00361    o In theory, the IRQ synchronization mechanism might end up
00362    causing interrupt loss, since we might be sleeping to much waiting
00363    on the irqlock barrier until it is signaled. In practice, this
00364    should not happen because interrupt-free sections are short thanks
00365    to the mutex scheme.
00366 */
00367 
00368 struct xnarch_tick_parms {
00369     time_t sec;
00370     long nsec;
00371     void (*tickhandler)(void);
00372     pid_t ppid;
00373     int syncflag;
00374 };
00375 
00376 static void *xnarch_timer_thread (void *cookie)
00377 
00378 {
00379     struct xnarch_tick_parms *p = (struct xnarch_tick_parms *)cookie;
00380     void (*tickhandler)(void) = p->tickhandler;
00381     struct timespec ts;
00382 
00383     pthread_create_rt("vmtimer",NULL,p->ppid,&p->syncflag,&vml_timer_handle);
00384     pthread_migrate_rt(FUSION_RTAI_DOMAIN);
00385 
00386     ts.tv_sec = p->sec;
00387     ts.tv_nsec = p->nsec;
00388 
00389     for (;;)
00390         {
00391         nanosleep(&ts,NULL);
00392         xnarch_sync_irq();
00393         tickhandler(); /* Should end up in xnpod_clock_irq() here. */
00394         }
00395 
00396     return NULL;
00397 }
00398 
00399 static inline void xnarch_start_timer (unsigned long nstick,
00400                                        void (*tickhandler)(void))
00401 {
00402     struct xnarch_tick_parms parms;
00403     struct sched_param param;
00404     unsigned long tickval;
00405     pthread_attr_t thattr;
00406     pthread_t thid;
00407 
00408     pthread_attr_init(&thattr);
00409     pthread_attr_setdetachstate(&thattr,PTHREAD_CREATE_DETACHED);
00410     pthread_attr_setschedpolicy(&thattr,SCHED_FIFO);
00411     param.sched_priority = sched_get_priority_min(SCHED_FIFO) + 2;
00412     pthread_attr_setschedparam(&thattr,&param);
00413 
00414     if (vml_info.tickval > nstick)
00415         {
00416         fprintf(stderr,"Xenomai/VM: warning: VM tick freq > nucleus tick freq\n");
00417         fprintf(stderr,"          : rounding VM tick to %lu us\n",vml_info.tickval / 1000);
00418         tickval = vml_info.tickval;
00419         }
00420     else
00421         {
00422         tickval = ((nstick + vml_info.tickval - 1) / vml_info.tickval) * vml_info.tickval;
00423 
00424         if (tickval != nstick)
00425             {
00426             fprintf(stderr,"Xenomai/VM: warning: VM tick not a multiple of nucleus tick\n");
00427             fprintf(stderr,"          : rounding VM tick to %lu us\n",tickval / 1000);
00428             }
00429         }
00430 
00431     parms.sec = tickval / 1000000000;
00432     parms.nsec = tickval % 1000000000;
00433     parms.tickhandler = tickhandler;
00434     parms.syncflag = 0;
00435     parms.ppid = getpid();
00436 
00437     pthread_create(&thid,&thattr,&xnarch_timer_thread,&parms);
00438     pthread_sync_rt(&parms.syncflag);
00439     pthread_start_rt(vml_timer_handle);
00440 }
00441 
00442 static inline void xnarch_stop_timer (void) {
00443     __pthread_cancel_vm(vml_timer_handle,NULL);
00444 }

00447 }

00449 static inline void xnarch_enter_root(xnarchtcb_t *rootcb) {
00450 }

00452 static inline void xnarch_switch_to (xnarchtcb_t *out_tcb,
00453                                      xnarchtcb_t *in_tcb) {
00454     vml_current = in_tcb;
00455     __pthread_activate_vm(in_tcb->khandle,out_tcb->khandle);
00456 }
00457 
00458 static inline void xnarch_finalize_and_switch (xnarchtcb_t *dead_tcb,
00459                                                xnarchtcb_t *next_tcb) {
00460     vml_current = next_tcb;
00461     __pthread_cancel_vm(dead_tcb->khandle,next_tcb->khandle);
00462 }
00463 
00464 static inline void xnarch_finalize_no_switch (xnarchtcb_t *dead_tcb) {
00465 
00466     __pthread_cancel_vm(dead_tcb->khandle,NULL);
00467 }

00477 static inline void xnarch_init_root_tcb (xnarchtcb_t *tcb,
00478                                          struct xnthread *thread,
00479                                          const char *name)
00480 {
00481     struct sched_param param;
00482 
00483     param.sched_priority = sched_get_priority_min(SCHED_FIFO);
00484 
00485     if (sched_setscheduler(0,SCHED_FIFO,&param) < 0 ||
00486         pthread_info_rt(&vml_info) < 0)
00487         {
00488         perror("Xenomai/VM");
00489         exit(1);
00490         }
00491 
00492     pthread_init_rt("vmroot",tcb,&tcb->khandle);
00493     pthread_migrate_rt(FUSION_RTAI_DOMAIN);
00494 
00495     tcb->name = name;
00496     vml_root = vml_current = tcb;
00497 }
00498 
00499 static inline void xnarch_init_tcb (xnarchtcb_t *tcb,
00500                                     void *adcookie) { /* <= UNUSED */
00501     tcb->khandle = NULL;
00502 }
00503 
00504 static void *xnarch_thread_trampoline (void *cookie)
00505 
00506 {
00507     xnarchtcb_t *tcb = (xnarchtcb_t *)cookie;
00508 
00509     if (!setjmp(tcb->rstenv))
00510         {
00511         /* After this, we are controlled by the in-kernel nucleus. */
00512         pthread_create_rt(tcb->name,tcb,tcb->ppid,&tcb->syncflag,&tcb->khandle);
00513         pthread_migrate_rt(FUSION_RTAI_DOMAIN);
00514         }
00515 
00516     xnarch_setimask(tcb->imask);
00517 
00518     xnpod_welcome_thread(tcb->thread);
00519 
00520     tcb->entry(tcb->cookie);
00521 
00522     return NULL;
00523 }
00524 
00525 static inline void xnarch_init_thread (xnarchtcb_t *tcb,
00526                                        void (*entry)(void *),
00527                                        void *cookie,
00528                                        int imask,
00529                                        struct xnthread *thread,
00530                                        char *name)
00531 {
00532     struct sched_param param;
00533     pthread_attr_t thattr;
00534 
00535     if (tcb->khandle)   /* Restarting thread */
00536         {
00537         pthread_kill(tcb->thid,XNARCH_SIG_RESTART);
00538         return;
00539         }
00540 
00541     tcb->imask = imask;
00542     tcb->entry = entry;
00543     tcb->cookie = cookie;
00544     tcb->thread = thread;
00545     tcb->name = name;
00546     tcb->ppid = getpid();
00547     tcb->syncflag = 0;
00548 
00549     pthread_attr_init(&thattr);
00550     pthread_attr_setdetachstate(&thattr,PTHREAD_CREATE_DETACHED);
00551     pthread_attr_setschedpolicy(&thattr,SCHED_FIFO);
00552     param.sched_priority = sched_get_priority_min(SCHED_FIFO);
00553     pthread_attr_setschedparam(&thattr,&param);
00554     pthread_create(&tcb->thid,&thattr,&xnarch_thread_trampoline,tcb);
00555 
00556     pthread_sync_rt(&tcb->syncflag);
00557 }
00558 
00559 static inline void xnarch_init_fpu(xnarchtcb_t *tcb) {
00560     /* Handled by the in-kernel nucleus */
00561 }
00562 
00563 int xnarch_setimask (int imask)
00564 
00565 {
00566     spl_t s;
00567     splhigh(s);
00568     splexit(!!imask);
00569     return !!s;
00570 }

00600 static inline void xnarch_halt (const char *emsg) {
00601     fprintf(stderr,"Xenomai/VM: fatal: %s\n",emsg);
00602     fflush(stderr);
00603     xnarch_exit_handler(SIGKILL);
00604     exit(99);
00605 }
